summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2, 2019, discussing operational planning following the indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It details the need to be on standby for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant. The email states he was indicted in SDNY and a warrant for his arrest has been sworn out. He is believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The recipient of the initial email, who responds 'Excellent thank you'. Likely a supervisor on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAO/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: The author of the main operational email, outlining the plan to arrest Epstein, search his residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida. Requests availability from the squad.

connections.person2: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAO/Human Trafficking FBI New York
connections.description: Internal FBI colleagues communicating about operational planning for the Epstein case, as shown in the email chain.

connections.person1: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAO/Human Trafficking FBI New York

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning Email
events.description: Internal FBI email outlines plans to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAO/Human Trafficking FBI New York

keyFacts: On July 2, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France. The FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI planned to execute a search warrant at Epstein's residence in New York City and interview co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to immediately deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals there.
The email indicates the investigation required the entire FBI squad, some assistance from other units (A4), and help from the branch, highlighting the scale of the operation.
